bug.short_desc: Explicit use of application root is forcing widgets to work with DOM elements

long_desc.thetext:
Throughout the framework the application root is accessed by
qx.core.Init.getApplication().getRoot()
to add listener to control the behaviour of several widgets which are absolute positioned like menus, popups and tooltips.
The application root of an inline application however is an hidden DIV element which does not receive any events, because the user cannot interact with this element. This causes to break e.g. ToolTips and menus.
-> Check the framework for explicit accessing of application root by using the Init class and examine if the implementation is correct.

The following parts are affected:
* Move- and Resize-Frames (MMovable and MResizable). The frames are rendered at the wrong position in the first place * Mouse-Wheel Support in SelectBox
Changed severity to "major".
We have to find a cleaner solution for this especially when multiple "qx.ui.root.Inline" instances are used.
-> Moving on to 0.8.3

Additionally popups are affected - bug is fixed but we have to find a cleaner solution for this. -> Changed priority to "P1"
A little background info: When using Inline applications all widgets which e.g. shown and hidden like popups are affected because their manager classes are listening to the application root ( qx.core.Init.getApplication().getRoot() ). This root widget however is not applicable for inline applications because the "qx.ui.root.Page" class does not appear and is therefore not suitable for listening for mouse events.
The current solution is to add the listener to the "document.documentElement" to e.g. get all the mouse events and retrieve at the listener method the corresponding widget of the DOM element with "qx.ui.core.Widget.getWidgetByElement". The beter approach would be that e.g. the manager classes at the UI core layer do not need to know these details and ALWAYS get a widget as target even the user clicked at the document when using an inline root.
Just my thoughts - we need to check how to implement this nicely :)

Maybe it's possible to enhance the "qx.ui.root.Page" widget to handle the "transformation" / look for mouse events at elements which are inside the inline root.
Changed bug description to better emphasize that this issue is not only affecting inline roots. The inline root widgets are the source of this issue, but we need tackle this down for the whole UI layer.
